comment: I have never really cared about Hollywood gossip. But I feel very emotionally invested in the defense of Johnny. Listening to the tapes, she is not interested in a solution or a healthy relationship. He comes up with great solutions and ways to work their problems out in a thoughtful way, and she continues to tell him why he's wrong the entire time, she berates him for separating himself from physical violence.  She is angry that he won't allow her to abuse him. She talks in a very crude manner to him, mocking him about a frienship he has with a male friend and tell him to "jerk him off" and all this other off the wall stuff. It's just awful. She is emotionally and physically abusive. I hear in the tapes, from Johnny, someone who is genuine and soft, and wants to work things out. She is terrible, and she is an abuser. ANd I think men and women can listen to her and know what NOT to do to be an abusive person themselves.

comment:
I am a life long, rabid, Stephen King fan. I should be Streaming the new version of The Stand.  But I'm not.  I messaged my beloved author to tell him why I couldn't watch it.  Heard was cast in the role of Nadine Cross.
I hope people take notice.  I was married to a sociopath for ten years, and I know what to look for now. I know about gaslighting, I know how crazy a sociopath goes when they lose the ability to manipulate and control you. They make you believe that everything is your fault, you're always wrong, they are always right. In, 10 years my husband apologized to me twice.  People ask, how didn't you know?  Because at first they seem normal, but they start in on you a little. Then more and more till they grind you into nothing.  She's furious Johnny wouldn't get into physical fights with her. Listen to the tapes.  Him walking away from the confrontation takes away her control and drives her crazy.  I want to hear what it's like to be her make up person or work on her costume.  Those are the people I want to talk to.

comment: She is not "provoking" fans by releasing pictures from the *first* "Aquaman" film, and the *reshoots* of "Justice League". All that does is inform the public that *she isn't doing anything* for the upcoming film (which hasn't begun production yet).  It is the same when she has her *pathetic lapdog, Daniel Richtman,* reporting *fictitious rumors* that she is "being considered for": the "Fast and Furious" franchise; the "Harry Potter" franchise (J. K. Rowling is a survivor of abuse, AND a good friend of Johnny Depp); Margot Robbie's "Pirate's of the Caribbean"; the "Fantastic Four" franchise; a Disney Princess (because Disney isn't AT ALL upset with her); the "Star Wars" franchise; a "Drive Angry" sequel; a solo "Mera" series; multiple Netflix projects; and an Oscar-caliber role... none of which has materialized.  Even "WeGotThisCovered" have admitted that *Richtman is no longer a reliable source* -- Richtman makes his money by charging on Patreon for his outlandish fantasies... and Ms. Heard is submitting to the Virginia Court a "Million" pages of internet gossip stories to prove that she *would* have gotten $100 Million worth of roles, but for "evil villain" Johnny Depp.  Apparently she believes that "rumors on the internet" are viable proof positive (she has never had a good grasp of what constitutes "proof") that she was considered... and it hasn't occurred to her that Mr. Depp's team simply has to contact the studio's and ask them to verify.   #JusticeForJohnnyDepp
